keyTakeAways: Nicholas Rossi, a 38-year-old man, was convicted of raping two women in northern Utah in 2008 and sentenced to five years to life in prison after allegedly faking his death to evade prosecution.
Rossi used multiple aliases, including Arthur Knight, and attempted to flee the U.S. by posing as dead in 2020, with an online obituary falsely claiming his death.
He was identified via a DNA match from a decade-old rape kit, part of Utah’s effort to clear its backlog of unsolved sexual assault cases.
After being arrested in Scotland due to distinctive tattoos and Interpol notice, he was extradited to Utah in January 2024 and prosecuted in two separate cases.
The victim in the first case testified about being groomed through a personal ad, financial manipulation, and being raped after becoming engaged, emphasizing the trauma and abuse.
The case underscores the dangers of sexual predators using aliases, fleeing, and exploiting legal and medical systems to evade accountability.
The sentence, ranging from five years to life, reflects the severity of the crime and the risk posed by such fugitive abusers to public safety.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A Utah judge sentenced Nicholas Rossi, a 38-year-old man, to five years to life in prison after convicting him of raping two women in northern Utah in 2008. Rossi, who used aliases such as Arthur Knight and falsely claimed to be dead in 2020, was identified through a decade-old DNA match from a rape kit backlog. He was arrested in Scotland in 2023 due to distinctive tattoos linked to an Interpol notice and extradited to Utah in January 2024. Despite claiming innocence and using false identities to evade justice, he was convicted in both a 2023 and a 2024 trial, with the first conviction leading to a prison sentence. The case highlights the dangers of predatory abusers using deception, aliases, and fake deaths to avoid accountability, and underscores the importance of addressing sexual assault backlogs and using DNA evidence to identify fugitives.
title: Man accused of faking his own death and fleeing the US after rape charges gets at least five years in prison
